alfredsnippet.snippet:
W M Davis, 1922, Origin of Coon Butte. In Biographical Memoirs, Nat. Acad. Sci. Memoirs, Vol 21, 5th Memoir

"William Morris Davis once pointed out with wry humor that astronomers tended to explain the craters of the moon by volcanic action, a geologic process, while geologists tended to explain them by meteoritic action, an astronomic process -- each scientist evidently feeling free to take liberties with a field other than his own."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Scientists Take Liberties With a Field Other Than Their Own
